title.narrative: Improving the System of Professional Development of Teachers and School Leaders in Estonia

description.narrative: Schools and school owners (local municipal governments, school governing bodies, state) are in position to provide clearer incentives for teachers and school leaders to participate in development programmes that are likely to have impact. Teachers and school leaders have the necessary tools to identify their unique development needs and identify suitable training programmes.

The Estonian authorities are aware of the options to improve the governance of teacher and school leader education and how to implement the needs assessment and impact evaluation tools. A set of impact criteria and evaluation principles have been established which can be used to design, deliver and finance programmes that are likely to have impact.

The Programme is financed through the Structural Reform Support Programme of the European Commission Directorate-General Reform who provides tailor-made technical support to EU countries, in cooperation with the relevant Commission services. The objective is to help EU countries build more effective institutions, stronger governance frameworks and efficient public administrations. Such support reinforces the capacity of EU countries to design and implement policies to support job creation and sustainable growth.

The overall objective is to develop a comprehensive system for the assessment of teacher needs, impact assessment and a quality management framework for teachers' and school leaders' professional development.
